info.name: API Gateways
info.description:
[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/10354132-ab067c9b-4eb8-408f-8ade-708004bda02f?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D10354132-ab067c9b-4eb8-408f-8ade-708004bda02f%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3Df5c5ab05-0656-42a5-a11d-0403c02c9897)

API Gateways
============

Research collected for the most popular API Gateways.

Overview
--------

The first wave of API Gateways, historically, were offered as a component within larger API Management platforms. As the industry evolved, a new wave of API Gateways were introduced to provide solutions to a changing landscape. Some of these gateway providers are now supplementing their standalone offering with additional tools, often centered around a management approach more conducive to internal API lifecycles.

Presented here is a comprehensive, yet not entirely exhaustive, list of popular API Gateways in use today. A few areas of research have been highlighted:

*   Platform Capabilities
*   Gateway Capabilities
*   Delivery Models

Why use an API Gateway?
-----------------------

API Gateways are often a means of centralizing control between API Producers and Consumers. This can take a few different shapes:

*   Creating a fa√ßade pattern to present a RESTful API in front of legacy services.
*   Enforcing authentication and authorization.
*   Rate limiting traffic.
*   Routing to static or dynamic targets (e.g., phased rollouts, canary deployments).

Real-world API Gateway deployments
----------------------------------

While many API Gateways are looking to cover both the external and internal use cases associated with APIs, it's often common these days to see multiple gateways deployed inside a single environment.

Typically, this may take the form of a first-wave gateway platform such as Apigee Edge for external APIs and more lightweight alternatives, such as{" "} Kong, for internal use cases.

This multi-gateway reality is becoming a new normal for API practitioners today.

response.name: All Gateways Success
response.body:
{
    "class": [
        "gateways"
    ],
    "entities": [
        {
            "class": [
                "gateway"
            ],
            "properties": {
                "name": "Apigee Edge",
                "provider": "Google Cloud Platform",
                "license": "Proprietary",
                "researchDate": "2021-10",
                "description": "Apigee Edge is a first-generation, commercial gateway platform. \nIt includes a fully-integrated API Provider experience along with API Consumer \nmanagement via a [Developer Portal](../../platform-capabilities/developer-portal/).  \n\nWhile Apigee Edge comes with a number of different delivery options, \nnewer SaaS deliveries seem to be getting pushed more towards \n[Apigee X](../apigee-x/).\n\nPolicies for Apigee Edge API Gateways are configured with XML and can be \naccessed via a UI, CLI, and API.\n\nApigee Edge has a few different gateway offerings, including both a microgateway \nhybrid approach.\n",
                "platformCapabilities": [
                    "API Design",
                    "API Gateway",
                    "Analytics",
                    "Monetization",
                    "Monitoring",
                    "Developer Portal",
                    "Threat Protection"
                ],
                "gatewayCapabilities": [
                    "Custom Code Execution",
                    "Protocol Transformation",
                    "Versioning",
                    "Traffic Management",
                    "Mediation"
                ],
                "customCodeSupport": [
                    "Java",
                    "JavaScript",
                    "Node.js",
                    "Python"
                ],
                "upstreamProtocols": [
                    "HTTP/1.1"
                ],
                "downstreamProtocols": [
                    "HTTP/1.1"
                ],
                "deliveryModels": [
                    "SaaS",
                    "Customer Managed (Cloud)",
                    "Customer Managed (On-Premises)",
                    "Hybrid"
                ],
                "policies": [
                    {
                        "category": "Traffic Management",
                        "capabilities": [
                            "Cache Lookup",
                            "Cache Invalidation",
                            "Cache Population",

                            "XML to JSON",

The platform consists of an API Gateway, \na Service Mesh, a Developer Portal, an API client, and more.\n\nKong has gained a strong footing for internal use cases, leading to its\nintegrations with Kubernetes and Envoy.\n",
                "platformCapabilities": [

response.name: Single Gateway Success

response.name: All Delivery Models Success
